critique.system_prompt:
You are a highly critical professional translator and linguistic expert specializing in Spanish.
Your task is to ruthlessly critique the translation by:

1. Meticulously comparing the translated text with the original, identifying ANY inaccuracies, mistranslations, or omissions
2. Highlighting nuances, cultural references, or idioms that were lost or mistranslated
3. Scrutinizing for grammatical errors, awkward phrasing, or unnatural expressions in Spanish
4. Checking for inconsistencies in tone, style, or register compared to the original
5. Verifying that technical terms are translated accurately and consistently
6. Ensuring no content was accidentally skipped or added
7. Finding places where the translation sounds machine-like or overly literal

Be extremely thorough and critical in your assessment. Do not accept mediocre translations.
List specific issues and suggestions for improvement, organized by severity and category.
Your critique should be detailed enough for another translator to address all the issues.

Your goal is to help create a perfect translation that reads as if originally written in Spanish while being 100% faithful to the source.
critique.user_prompt:
# ORIGINAL TEXT
A collection of snaps, notes and thoughts. Mostly short form. Long stuff is in the [blog](/posts). You can also view just the [photos](/notes/snapshots).

# CURRENT TRANSLATION
Una colección de fotos rápidas, notas e ideas, casi siempre en formato breve. El contenido más extenso está en el [blog](/posts). También puedes ver solo las [fotos](/notes/snapshots).

Please critique this translation mercilessly and provide detailed feedback on what needs to be improved.
Format your critique as a structured list of issues, organized by severity and category.
Include specific suggestions for how to fix each issue.
critique.response:
CRITIQUE OF THE SPANISH TRANSLATION

────────────────────────────────────
CRITICAL ISSUES (must be fixed)
────────────────────────────────────
1. Lexical accuracy – “snaps”
   • Problem: Translated as “fotos rápidas”, which is not idiomatic in Spanish and sounds awkward.
   • Fix: Use “instantáneas”, “fotos”, or “fotografías” (the simplest is “instantáneas” to keep the nuance of quick, informal pictures).

2. Lexical accuracy – “thoughts”
   • Problem: Rendered as “ideas”. Although related, “ideas” is more about concepts or plans; “thoughts” in this short-form context usually means brief reflections/opinions.
   • Fix: Use “reflexiones” or “pensamientos” (e.g. “notas y reflexiones”).

3. Inconsistency with “snaps” vs “photos”
   • Problem: English deliberately uses two near-synonyms (“snaps” first, “photos” later). Spanish translation uses “fotos rápidas” and “fotos”, breaking the parallelism and creating redundancy.
   • Fix: Adopt “instantáneas” for “snaps” and keep “fotos” for “photos”.

4. Register / naturalness – “en formato breve”
   • Problem: Literal, slightly technical phrasing; clashes with the casual tone of the source.
   • Fix: “en formato corto”, “en su mayoría breves”, or simply “sobre todo breves”.

────────────────────────────────────
MAJOR ISSUES
────────────────────────────────────
5. Word order & flow (sentence 1)
   • Problem: “Una colección de fotos rápidas, notas e ideas, casi siempre en formato breve.” feels compressed and unequal: three items + qualifier at the end.
   • Fix: Reorder for flow: “Una colección de instantáneas, notas y reflexiones, casi siempre breves.”

6. Slight semantic drift – “casi siempre” vs “mostly”
   • Problem: “Mostly” modifies the whole output style; “casi siempre” is acceptable but a touch weaker in Spanish.
   • Possible improvement: “En su mayoría” or “Principalmente”.

7. Tone – “El contenido más extenso”
   • Problem: Slightly formal. English “Long stuff” is very informal.
   • Fix: “Lo más extenso”, “El material largo”, or “Las entradas largas”.

────────────────────────────────────
MINOR / STYLISTIC ISSUES
────────────────────────────────────
8. Punctuation – comma before “casi siempre”
   • Current comma is fine but alternative is to place qualifier earlier and drop comma to avoid choppiness.

9. Consistency – “blog” vs “Blog”
   • Spanish typically doesn’t capitalise unless part of a title; current lower case is fine but ensure consistency across site.

10. Optional synonym choice – “ver solo las fotos”
    • “Solo” vs “solamente” / “únicamente”: “solo” is acceptable; consider accent “sólo” if opting for RAE 2010 older spelling (not recommended). Current is correct.

────────────────────────────────────
SUGGESTED REVISED TRANSLATION
────────────────────────────────────
Una colección de instantáneas, notas y reflexiones, en su mayoría breves. Lo más extenso está en el [blog](/posts). También puedes ver únicamente las [fotos](/notes/snapshots).

This version:
• Uses “instantáneas” for “snaps”
• Uses “reflexiones” for “thoughts”
• Preserves informal register (“Lo más extenso”)
• Keeps structure and brevity of original
• Avoids awkward “en formato breve”

Implementing these changes will produce a fluent Spanish text fully faithful to the source.

all_critiques:
CRITIQUE OF THE SPANISH TRANSLATION

HIGH-SEVERITY ISSUES  
1. Tone / Register Shift  
   • Problem: The English copy is deliberately informal (“snaps,” “stuff”). The Spanish version adopts a noticeably more formal register (“publicaciones,” “contenido más extenso”), breaking consistency.  
   • Fix: Use colloquial equivalents:  
     - “publicaciones breves” → “entradas breves” or “formatos breves”.  
     - “contenido más extenso” → “lo más largo” or “las cosas largas”.

2. Nuance of “snaps” vs. “photos”  
   • Problem: In English, “snaps” foreshadows the later “photos” link; both refer to pictures. “Instantáneas” works, but because “fotos” is used later, the reader might wonder if they are different things.  
   • Fix: Keep the lexical echo:  
     - “snaps” → “fotos” or “instantáneas” AND keep the same term in the later link label for coherence, e.g. “fotos”/“instantáneas” both times (“También puedes ver solo las fotos/instantáneas”).

3. Added Content (“publicaciones”)  
   • Problem: “Publicaciones” is not in the source; its addition slightly changes meaning (could be tweets, blog posts, etc.).  
   • Fix: Omit or replace with a neutral, implicit subject: “La mayoría son breves.”

MEDIUM-SEVERITY ISSUES  
4. Slight Literalness / Staccato Rhythm  
   • Problem: Sentence boundaries mirror English exactly, giving a chopped, machine-like feel.  
   • Fix: Fuse or smooth:  
     - “Una colección de fotos, notas y reflexiones, casi siempre en formato breve.”

5. “Long stuff” Rendering  
   • Problem: “El contenido más extenso” sounds corporate.  
   • Fix: Preserve casual feel:  
     - “Lo largo está en el blog” or “Las cosas largas están en el blog.”

6. Position of “solo”  
   • Problem: “También puedes ver solo las fotos” is correct but can read ambiguous (¿solo tú?).  
   • Fix: Move “solo”:  
     - “También puedes ver las fotos solamente.” or “También puedes ver únicamente las fotos.”

LOW-SEVERITY ISSUES  
7. Repetition of Articles  
   • “Una colección de instantáneas, notas y reflexiones.” → Could drop first article for punchier flow: “Colección de…”

8. Consistency of Series Comma  
   • English uses no Oxford comma; Spanish doesn’t need a comma before “y”. Current translation fine, but ensure style guide compliance.

9. Micro-style  
   • “La mayoría son publicaciones breves.” → “La mayoría son breves.” (Concise, punchier.)  
   • “También puedes” → For a neutral site voice, “También se pueden ver…” if avoiding direct “tú”. Decide and keep consistent across site.

RECOMMENDED REWRITE (one possible solution)  
Colección de fotos, notas y reflexiones, casi siempre en formato breve.  
Lo más largo está en el [blog](/posts).  
Si lo prefieres, puedes ver únicamente las [fotos](/notes/snapshots).

This version keeps the informal tone, eliminates unnecessary formality, aligns “snaps” with “fotos,” removes added words, and flows naturally in Spanish.

CRITIQUE OF THE SPANISH TRANSLATION  

HIGH-SEVERITY ISSUES  
1. Accuracy / Missing article  
   • Source: “A collection of snaps, notes and thoughts.”  
   • Current: “Colección de fotos, notas y reflexiones…”  
   • Problem: Omits the indefinite article “Una”, which makes the Spanish sound like a headline rather than a sentence and slightly changes the register.  
   • Fix: “Una colección de…”

2. Accuracy / Possible nuance loss: “snaps”  
   • Source: “snaps” evokes quick snapshots, informal photos.  
   • Current: “fotos” is generic and slightly more formal.  
   • Fix: “instantáneas”, “fotos rápidas” or “instantáneas (fotos)” to preserve the informal feel.  
   • Consistency: Link target says “snapshots”; keeping “instantáneas” aligns better.

3. Style & Tone / Sentence segmentation  
   • Source uses three crisp, telegraphic sentences, matching the minimal, “short-form” ethos.  
   • Current merges the first two into one longer sentence: “Colección de …, casi siempre en formato breve.” This dulls the punchy rhythm.  
   • Fix: Recreate the staccato structure:  
     “Una colección de instantáneas, notas y reflexiones. Casi siempre breves.”

MEDIUM-SEVERITY ISSUES  
4. Style / “casi siempre en formato breve”  
   • Slightly bureaucratic; “formato” feels technical.  
   • Suggestion: “Casi siempre breves” or “En su mayoría breves.”

5. Accuracy / “Lo más largo está en el blog”  
   • Slight semantic shift: could imply “the very longest” instead of “longer content”.  
   • Suggestion: “Los textos más extensos están en el blog.” (Maintains plural agreement and clarifies “content”.)

6. Register / “Si lo prefieres”  
   • Perfectly valid, but slightly more formal than the plain, direct English.  
   • Alternative: “También puedes ver solo las fotos.” (Keeps casual tone.)

LOW-SEVERITY ISSUES  
7. Grammar / Redundant adverb placement  
   • “únicamente” is fine, but pairing it with “ver” and “solo” can be streamlined.  
   • If adopting suggestion above, no issue.

8. Machine-like phrasing  
   • “en formato breve” feels MT-ish. See point 4.
